intro: Fadogia glaberrima, commonly known as African velvet bean, is a leguminous plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its compound leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into pods containing kidney-shaped seeds. The plant thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in savannas and forest edges. It has a shallow root system and is adapted to nutrient-poor soils. Fadogia glaberrima is also valued for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of protein-rich seeds.
